title: Merge /resume-work into /next
description:
## Problem

`/resume-work` and `/next` both answer "what should I do?" with overlapping triggers (`continue working`). Users must choose between two commands when one context-aware skill would suffice.

## Design

Merge into a single `/next` skill with context-aware behavior:

1. **Detect trunk:** `gt parent 2>/dev/null || gt trunk` (same pattern as split-commit, implement, pr-description)
2. **On a feature branch** (not trunk) with commits/PR/active issue → run resume-work logic (branch status, PR, CI, reviews, stale branches, suggest action)
3. **On trunk or no active branch work** → run board logic (pick highest-priority unblocked item, classify, dispatch)
4. **All triggers** (`next`, `resume`, `where was I`, `continue working`) map to `/next`
5. **Delete `/resume-work`** skill directory after merge

## Key details

- Trunk detection must be auto-discovered, never hardcoded to "main"
- When on feature branch, don't show board noise
- When on trunk, don't show stale-branch scanning or PR checks
- The resume-work logic becomes an internal branch of `/next`, not a separate dispatch target
